bestBHT.bht: False messiahs will hide in the desert or secret chambers to avoid public scrutiny. The caution is against enthusiasm, superstition, and fanaticism, as these impostors lead followers into the wilderness with private schemes of deliverance. However, the true Messiah will extend his kingdom to the ends of the world, far beyond the limited boundaries of Judea. It is important not to be deceived by those who claim the Messiah can only be found in secret chambers. The true Messiah has already come and revealed himself to Israel.

Albert Barnes: Behold, he is in the desert.
Marvin Vincent: In the desert - Secret chambers. Rev., wilderness - inner chambers. Both retired places, indicating that the false Messiahs will avoid public scrutiny.
John Calvin: For we know that the false Christs —in accordance with the gross and foolish hope of that nation—drew along with them as large bodies of men as they could collect into the recesses of the desert, or into caverns, or other places of retirement, in order to throw off the yoke of the Roman government by force and by arms.

The disciples were thus reminded that they must no longer seek a Redeemer within the small enclosure of Judea, because he will suddenly extend the limits of his kingdom to the uttermost ends of the world.
For it could not be the result of human industry, that the light of the gospel, as soon as it appear, darted from one side of the world to the opposite side like lightning.
Philip Schaff: Behold, he is in the wilderness, whither the impostors led their followers.
Behold, he is in the inner chambers, teaching in private, proposing some scheme of deliverance.
The caution then is against enthusiasm, superstition, and fanaticism, in the days of the waiting Church.
Archibald T. Robertson: In the wilderness (εν τη ερημω). Like Simon son of Gioras (Josephus, War, IV,9,5,&7).
In the inner chambers (εν τοις ταμειοις). Like John of Giscala (Josephus, War, V,6,1).
False Messiahs act the role of the Great Unseen and Unknown.
John Gill: Do not go out of the places where you are to see, or hear, and know the truth of things; lest you should, in any respect, be stumbled, ensnared, and brought into danger.
Behold, he is in the secret chambers, believe it not.
The true Messiah is come, and has showed himself to Israel; and even the giving out these things discovers a consciousness, and a conviction that the Messiah is come.

bhtAttempts.bht: False messiahs will avoid public scrutiny, hiding in the desert or in secret chambers, acting as the Great Unseen and Unknown. In the days of the waiting Church, the caution is against enthusiasm, superstition, and fanaticism. These impostors led their followers into the wilderness, proposing schemes of deliverance in private. However, the disciples were reminded that the true Messiah would extend the limits of his kingdom to the ends of the world, far beyond the small enclosure of Judea. The light of the gospel would spread like lightning, revealing the truth to all. Therefore, they were warned not to be deceived by those who claimed that the Messiah could only be found in secret chambers. The true Messiah had already come and showed himself to Israel.

They were warned not to be deceived by those who claimed the Messiah could only be found in secret chambers. The true Messiah had already come and showed himself to Israel.
